page.title: 17Farming (1)
page.content:
Farming is the principal industry of the area. Farm acreages range from 40 upwards, with field sizes from 5 to 50 acres. Few farmers have contiguous land boundaries, and some travel in from neighbouring villages to reach their land.
Citizens band radio keeps isolated households in touch with their families working on the land. Farms are well mechanised with tractors, combines etc. Crops grown are wheat, barley oats, sugar beet, potatoes, carrots, feed beans, rape and a little maize. Only one farmer keeps cattle and pigs, and there is no dairy farming. Shooting interests vary from the large landowner with gamekeeper to smallholds with rough shooting.
